doc.after: Scientific fields are commonly divided into two major groups natural sciences which study natural phenomena including biological life and social sciences which study human behavior and societies These groupings are empirical sciences which means the knowledge must be based on observable phenomena and capable of being tested for its validity by other researchers working under the same conditions 74 There are also related disciplines that are grouped into interdisciplinary applied sciences such as engineering and medicine Within these categories are specialized scientific fields that can include parts of other scientific disciplines but often possess their own nomenclature and expertise 75
